Fields.DialogueText: The wind is picking up. How is she handling the swells, my lady?
Swells of three meters? My hull has fared much worse. Still, the wind is picking up quite quickly.
I like it, though - it's nice to taste the salt in the air. Sometimes being in the bridge all day gives me cabin fever!
That's why I enjoy a nice soak in my quarters, Kanchou! The hot, medicated waters do wonders for my mental state.
I certainly could use a bath. I've been up for days!
You push yourself so hard. Allow me to man the bridge. Please get yourself some rest.

Fields.MenuText: Thanks, Naka! I'll head to my quarters for a quick shower and a nap!
No need, Naka! I have to set an example for my crew.
Why don't you and I settle for a cup of tea in my quarters?

Fields.DialogueText: Certainly! I need my kanchou rested and looking sharp!
You're an inspiration, but you're starting to smell...
I suppose we both could sneak off for a few minutes.
*ALARM*
What did I tell you? No time for rest!
Win this battle, and I will see to it personally that you get some well deserved R&R!
It's a deal!
@BATTLE
This is nice. Tea in my quarters. A nap. A bath of all things! I can't believe how much I have missed the small pleasures of life.
Feeling refreshed, Kanchou? I prepared the tea myself. Jasmine sencha!
You didn't have to do that for me! The galley could have easily taken care of that.
Nonsense. Those cooks never know how to heat the water properly or how long to steep the leaves! I couldn't leave it to chance.
Whoah! Those swells are really crashing.
They seem to be at least four meters and growing. The wind is getting worse.
I should get to the bridge then. As capable as Officer Furuichi is, I want an eye on the navigation.
Very good, Kanchou - but perhaps you should change out of your pajamas first.
... I used to have nightmares like this.
Mm. I don't know how seriously the crew would take you with sailboats on your pants.

Fields.MenuText: That's enough out of you!
Would you please turn around for a second?
Should I wear nothing instead?

Fields.DialogueText: Ahem. Hai, Kanchou. I'll see myself to the bridge.
Hai. I understand the need for privacy.
Kanchou! Have some decency!
*ALARM*
I sense a Morgana fleet mere leagues off the stern! Do you need a hand, Kanchou?
No time! To the bridge, sailboat pajamas be damned!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Great Heavens above, the wind is going to rip my clothes off!
Wouldn't we all love to see that, haha!
Be careful officer, don't stand to close to the ledge.
Min'na kiwotsukete! The swells are pushing past five meters!
That's not the only thing pushing our way – rogue Morganas off the bow!
@BATTLE
Where is Officer Furuichi?
HELP! HELP!
Oh my GOD! Furuichi is overboard. Hold my pants, I'm diving in!
Lieutenant!

Fields.MenuText: Lieutenant! Trousers stay on! Stardard operating procedure!
Grab the life preserver, we'll save her!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. I apologize. SOP calls for a life preserver. I'll grab it.
Exactly! Just like SOP says! I'm coming, Furuichi!
Adjust aim twelve degrees East. Throw life preserver!
Preserver away! Grab it!
Got it! Pull!
Furuichi! Are you all right? Let's get her out of these clothes before she catches hypothermia.
Perhaps a towel first...
I'm fine! I'm fine. But... I saw something while I was down there.
A tunnel of light? She's fading fast!
Baka. It... it was a shipwreck. It looked new. Not a warship, but... I saw bodies floating around there.
A shipwreck! We need frogmen down there, now!
Searchlights on!
... That came out entirely wrong.
Kanchou. We've recovered several dozen bodies. No survivors.
Have we discerned the nationality?
Hai. The marking appear to be Soviet - and there seem to have been a number of civilian passengers. It couldn't have been sunk more than a month ago.

Fields.MenuText: Get Marks to radio Moscow. They're going to want to do a full investigation.
See how soon we can get divers back down below. I want as many bodies recovered as possible.
What the hell were they doing out here in the first place? Science team, or...

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! Lieutenant! Lieutenant!
Officer Furuichi is speaking with them currently. I'll send them out soon.
I don't know, Kanchou.
Kanchou, we have a report from the divers. It's about the nature of the attack.
Are all divers back aboard?
Yes, Kanchou. Apparently, this wasn't Morgana work. This was a human attack.
What leads us to that conclusion?
The ship seems to have been stripped of its valuables before being sunk.
Captain! Morgana fleet emerging from the mist! We have to respond!
Secure all rescue material. Maneuver from the civilian wreck and meet them head on!
@BATTLE
Pirates. Son of a...
I can't believe that a human being could do this. It seems so... cruel.
I try to forget that sometimes. When fighting the Morganas, it gives me a sense of hope – that what we fight for is just and good. This attack though...
Don't dwell on those thoughts. You'll only work yourself up again. How about a nice hot cup of sake. Perks of being on a Japanese ship!
No, thanks. I want to remain calm and level headed. That way, if something like this starts to happen again, I can stop it before innocent lives are lost!
Captain, the Russians are on their way. We've sent them the coordinates of the wreck.
Should we wait for them to arrive?

Fields.MenuText: They have the coordinates. We don't have time to idle.
I suppose we could wait.
You're the navigator, Furuichi. Tell me your thoughts.

Fields.DialogueText: Very good, Kanchou. We'll drop a buoy to be on the safe side.
Pardon the pun, but you don't sound "on board."
I don't want to be sitting ducks for the Morganas. We should get underway.
Who could have done this?
*ALARM*
Have... your... death!
@BATTLE
I'll take care of that, Captain!
If you're worried about Morganas, we could drop a buoy for the Russians and move on.
Let's drop a buoy while we have a spare moment, and get underway.

Fields.MenuText: Just because we have a common enemy in the Morganas doesn't mean humanity has risen above its baser instincts.
People are pretty damn good at cruelty, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: Marks, say something reassuring to Furuichi for me. I'm busy planning retribution.
In the heat of the battle, we were able to obtain what appears to be a captain's log from the wreck.
Flawless execution, Kanchou. It says here that the Soviet kanchou saw what appeared to be an American ship on the horizon. That is the last entry.
Oh, hell. Tell me nobody's breached the neutrality accords.
Look at the entry more closely – "appeared" to be an American ship.
You think it may not have been.
May have, may not have. Might not have been military. All that we know is that a ship that appeared to be American was the last sighting of the freighter.
Well, the looting tells us it wasn't American Navy. And it wasn't an accidental sinking.
It has to be a rogue ship.
It's unthinkable, though. How could pirates even operate with all this naval activity?
The Pacific ocean's a big place, and if cargo ships go missing people will just blame the Morganas. It makes a certain amount of sense if you're crazy enough.
If I had these thieves on the deck of my ship... I would show them no mercy!

Fields.MenuText: Straight to the brig!
I'm pretty sure Neutrality Fleet protocols would lead us to turn them over to the Soviets. I don't think you'd have to worry about an excess of mercy there.
I think it'd be fitting for them to walk the plank!

Fields.DialogueText: I am pleased to tell you the brig is completely empty. Our crew is of an unimpeachable character!
You know that citing procedure is a way to a Belle's hear– uh, mind, Kanchou.
All's fair in love and war.
We recovered the doll of a little girl. She's waterlogged, but... but...   *sobs*
Kanchou, we have to avenge this liner. We must bring justice to these brigands!
I agree, Lady Naka. But we need a lead to follow. Otherwise, we're shooting in the dark!
I understand.... Kanchou, should I console Officer Furuichi?
No need. We all know Lieutenant Marks is more than capable.
Thank you, Captain. Um... permission to chase after her?
Get running, Lieutenant.
*ALARM*
She'll be heading to the bridge, then. As should you, on the double!
Yes, Lady Naka!
To battle!
@BATTLE
Captain, independent sightings confirm that we're dealing with a ship flying American colors. The good news is that it wasn't a military ship, or at least not anymore.
So maybe a hijacked freighter. Something that was written off as a loss to the Morganas.
An astute observation. We have a rogue American freighter in the Pacific, most likely trawling for scraps, post-Morgana battle.
But in this case, the pirates beat the Morganas to the punch?
It appears that way.
A freighter can remain at sea for a significant amount of time, but all ships have to pull into port eventually.
What are you thinking, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I'm thinking that we need to find the port!
No American port would take that ship, right?
I pay you to think for me!

Fields.DialogueText: No way any port in Japan or the United States would let that ship in.
Affirmative. Nor would the Japanese. We need to find a neutral port.
Well, the safest course of action would be for it to find a neutral port.
So it needs to be a neutral port. What's the closest neutral port to our position?
That's an Officer Furuichi question, Captain.
Furuichi!
Heard everything! Closest freeport is the Portuguese colony of Macau.
Excellent, set course for Macau.
Port of call! I can't wait to visit the bars. Petty Officer Bronson told me of one where the girls are dressed –
Ahem?!
Dressed very modestly because the men respect women.
Quit bickering! Morgana fleet on the horizon!
@BATTLE
When we get to Macau, will you get me a Malassada?

Fields.MenuText: Mala-wha?
I don't know if I'm leaving the boat, but I'll make sure Marks brings back treats.
Anything for you! I'll bring you back ten!

Fields.DialogueText: A Portuguese sweet bread. For a kanchou, you're not very knowledgeable.
Ah, as long as it isn't too much trouble.
Hehe, you're too kind, but one is all I need. I have to stay in fighting shape!
*ALARM*
Kanchou, Funayūrei on our tail!
Show them our might!
Flawless execution!
@BATTLE
We're getting good at these battles! It must be because of how close we have grown as a team!
H-hai. We all have grown so close.
Like a big family. Naka and the Kanchou are the parents, hehe!

Fields.MenuText: Does that make you and Marks our kids?
Let's not let any higher ups hear this fraternization.
How do you and the Lieutenant factor in?

Fields.DialogueText: (gulps) I don't think I thought through my metaphor.
Hehe, yes, Kanchou!
Ah, well, you know. Unrelated, what makes a good gift to buy a Lieutenant while in port?
I can't wait to get to Macau. I know we have a job to do, but I want to see the sights! Buy some treasures, so that after the war, I have something to remember.
I don't suppose a malassada will make the voyage across the sea?
Hm? Hehe, no it is more of an "enjoy it while it lasts" food.
Perhaps I could try to find something that might be a little more durable. A pearl perhaps?
You're playing a dangerous game, Kanchou.
Huh? I... I should go.
I guess we're alone now.
Hai... Kanchou. Hai...
One must always visualize three moves ahead if one hopes to secure victory.
For its lack of protocol, I find it charming.
The fastest way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
There are those damn Morganas! Let's get them!
@BATTLE
Macau! Sometimes, I truly wish I were able to leave this ship.
We could hop off and enjoy the edge of the shore!
I appreciate the effort, but... hanging mere meters from the edge of my ship isn't the same as exploring the city, Kanchou.
I'm sorry, Miss Naka.
You know me too well to call me "Miss," Kanchou.
Yet you still call me "Kanchou?"
You are my kanchou. I am your Belle.

Fields.MenuText: You're an odd mix of formality and informality. I don't know how to read you.
I think we have grown closer than just that.
What would you prefer I call you?

Fields.DialogueText: I apologize for using decorum as a shield. I rarely fraternize, and it is only with those I trust.
Amaterasu above, it is hot in Macau!
Naka, or my lady.
I brought you a gift.
Malassada! I've always wanted one! Arigatō!
How's it taste?
Well?
I must apologize. It is too sweet for my liking. Those Europeans don't understand subtleties!
Om nom nom! These sweetbreads are amazing! I can't believe we have three dozen! What a sale! I owe you, Furuichi!
Buy me a drink or two, and maybe I'll call it even!
I stand by what I said.
Howabout some nigiri? My quarters?
Arigatō, Kanchou.
Where is everyone else on the bridge?
Not on the bridge. Sorry, that was my attempt at humor. I've been told my wit is "dry."
Dry and charming as it is, we need Furuichi and Marks.
... and you'll come in a few seconds after me...
HELLO, NAKA CREW! I got the best night's sleep. Ah! What did I miss?

Fields.MenuText: You're late, Lieutenant!
Ask Naka - she's the only one who's been manning the bridge!
Nothing, but you're on time for me to chew you out! Lazy *&#@!%&*#!@

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! I'm so sorry. I was grabbing everyone tea. Would you like a cup? Matcha!
Right! Naka, I'm terribly sorry, how about a fresh made cup of tea?
Ah! Not the dreaded chew-out! I'm sorry, Captain! I brought tea?
Ohayo, Crew! I brought tea! Sencha, who would like a cup?!
Furuichi! We talked about this!
Isn't this interesting!
We need to focus! Last night while you two were doing... whatever it is you did, I got a lead on our ship.
Tell us!
It's moored on the other side of the harbor, we need to get eyes on it, but discreetly.
I'm on it... oh! Kanchou! Miss Naka! Morganas streaming to the harbor. We have to act now or Macau could be lost!
But what about the pirates?
Those will have to wait. Lives are in danger now! Keep an eye on those fiends if you can spare a moment, but our priority lies in battle!
Let's show them no mercy!
@BATTLE
We've lost visual, Kanchou. They escaped in the battle?
Not quite escaped, Captain! We can catch them if we aren't intercepted by any more Morganas.
I foresee that being difficult.
Increase speed by five knots.
Why is that, Naka?
It appears there is another wave of Funayūrei, approaching from the east.
What do we do, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Engage enemy fleet!
Pursue the rogues!
Let's go with a third option...

Fields.DialogueText: If we swing to the north, we can trap the pirates between us and the Morganas.
Hold on, Kanchou. I might be able to position the Morganas and pirates into a trap!
B-both at the same time? Let me see what I can do!
Excellent - we will lure the Morganas near the pirate vessel, ensuring they are caught between us and certain death!
Let's ease off the death...
Commence operation!
@BATTLE
Their ship has stopped moving. It appears to have been incapacitated!
Pull along her broadside.
Officer, pull along her broadside!
Aye, ma'am!
Naka, come with me. We'll meet their party.
Hai. Thank you, Kanchou.
A Japanese ship? Yer a long way from the Sea of Japan, ain'tcha?

Fields.MenuText: Surrender or we will sink your ship.
No voyage is too far for justice!
Aren't you supposed to be a merchant ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeh ain't even tell us what we been charged with!
Great, one of those heroic types...
Aren't you supposed to be fighting Morganas?
Akutō! We'll make this simple –
Aku what? If you're talking to me, call me Captain Vickers.
You don't deserve the title of kanchou! You soil it!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Your ship is rudderless, Vickers. You have no choice.
Surrender to us, and we'll ensure you receive a fair trial.
I'd rather be sunk than give into you.
Is that your answer, Captain?
Yes, "Captain." Better get back to your ship with your keeper.
Keeper! Come now, Kanchou, let's take his ship!
We don't have the time. You have sealed your fate and that of your crew, Vickers.
We'll see you in hell!
You're troubled by this, Naka?
No, Kanchou. Karma shall be their judge. We should pull away.
HYAAAA!
What was that?
Hm?
I thought I heard something.
It'll have to wait, Naka. To the bridge.
But... I feel something... moving on my hull.
@BATTLE
Captain! You have to head to the brig, right away. We captured a stowaway!

Fields.MenuText: Naka was right!
It better not be one of those pirates!

Fields.DialogueText: Well, she certainly knows the ship better than anybody!
Prepare to be disappointed - she looks quite dastardly.
Right. Take me there, immediately. The stowaway must have climbed aboard during the heat of the battle.
Of course, Captain. We haven't been able to ascertain if she is a refugee or a saboteur, but– WATCH WHERE YOU'RE GOING, CAPTAIN ON DECK– she was armed with a pistol.
I trust you removed that from her?
She may have knocked it against my skull first... here we are!
Is this how you treat guests, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Not just another civilian volunteer who jumped the line?

Fields.DialogueText: No. This looks considerably more dangerous than the usual.
I need somebody with binoculars to look over there and tell me if I'm imagining-
*ALARM*
Never mind.
@BATTLE
That'll be all, Lieutenant. Head back to the bridge.
I trust you find Naka's quarters to be comfortable?
Far better than the hole I was previously in. Where will I sleep?
Madam. This is where we talk, not where you sleep. Cooperate or we'll send you back to the brig whence you came.
Where did you drag her out of, Captain - a story book?

Fields.MenuText: She's the Belle of the ship! Show some respect!
I find her vocabulary to be incredibly charming.
Yeah, Naka, catch up to the 20th century!

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou.
And I find the Kanchou's resolve to be artful. Together we are unstoppable!
Don't make me throw you overboard...
Enough pleasantries. Why are you on my ship? What do you want?
I want to live! Isn't that enough? I was taken hostage by a bunch of lunatics who then resigned us to a death by Morgana. No, thank you!
You were a hostage, hm? Where would you like us to take you?
Naka?
Please. Continue.
I'd be off at the next port! Drop me anywhere you drop anchor!
Great. Our next port of call is Vladivostok, in the Soviet Far East.
Vladivostok! What business does a Japanese cruiser have in Russia?
Does that upset you?
N-no. Not at all. It's great!
*ALARM*
Conversation tabled. Naka, to the bridge?
What about the prisoner?
Honored guest!
Send her to the galley. Kitchen duty!
@BATTLE
She's clearly lying.
Technically, you were too. I don't recall any business in Vladivostok.
I merely was trying to ascertain her discomfort at a Soviet port of call, to see if she had anything to do with the sunken liner.
She did seem uncomfortable. Then again, so am I. She doesn't have good odds of escape in Vladivostok as opposed to, say, Singapore.
Do you really think that all she wants is to survive?
I honestly don't know, nor do I know what to do with her. We don't have any specific evidence of wrongdoing, and I don't know that I like the idea of asking the Soviets to sort it out.
You were comfortable with it before.
I thought it was a good idea to make an example of a pirate ship - but the Morganas took care of that for us.
We have to have justice for those drowned, Kanchou!
Negative, Kanchou. Vickers escaped responsibility and remorse for his crime. His death was the easy way out. Someone must be held accountable.
Naka, your sense of honor is amazing, and I am in awe of it. But we cannot let this cloud our judgment!
I have served you well as the kami of the ship. I resent that you think this could cloud my judgment!
Naka! Naka! I didn't mean it that way. We have a war to fight! Naka?
Women troubles?
Marks?
Sure, don't tell ol' Marks anything. Buying her malassada, talking in private, then a young pirate wench stows on board and you and the lady are fighting...

Fields.MenuText: I don't believe she and I are at that level.
I should make it up to her.
Pirate? There's nothing between us! I can't lose Naka!

Fields.DialogueText: Yet. Right??
I've heard chocolate and flowers along with a groveling apology usually works.
Sing her a song! Let her know how you really feel!
She's... special, okay? That's all I can say!
Right, because she knows all within these metal walls. Better not go running your mouth off.
It's that darned pirate. Once we figure her out, this whole thing will fall into place.
*ALARM*
Looks like you and Naka need to mend fences fast. We're on war footing!
Launch torpedoes!
@BATTLE
One crew member - or possible hostage - is less of a threat. And if there's any chance she's innocent I don't want to just throw her into a gulag.

Fields.MenuText: Vickers and his ship are already gone. That's not justice enough?
Our... visitor isn't going anywhere for now, Naka. Keep an eye on her and see what you can learn.
Naka, as far as the Neutrality Fleet is concerned, all we can prove is that she's a stowaway.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree that she's lying, but until we can prove it we keep our powder dry.
It's not right! Vickers escaped responsibility and remorse for his crime. His death was the easy way out. Someone must be held accountable.
I understand. But... Kanchou, Vickers escaped responsibility and remorse for his crime. His death was the easy way out. Someone must be held accountable.
We can take them! Officers, to your stations!
@BATTLE
Okay, one little apology. No big deal. Apology and, uh, chocolate.
Ahem (knocks) Lady Naka? Lady Naka, may I come in?
Take your shoes off before entering.
How may I help you, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I was hoping we could talk about our previous encounter.
What are your opinions on chocolate?
I'm really really sorry!!!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. It would be best to clear the air.
I find it to be pleasant, but I don't understand what this relates to.
Um. Thank you... but take a breath, Kanchou.
I am sorry that I suggested your judgment might be clouded. That was wrong of me, and I was out of line.
I understand, Kanchou... and it wasn't entirely out of line. My sense of duty compelled me to seek a solution to the crisis, without taking into account the realities of war.
I wanted you to have this. It's an apology gift.
Chocolate? Arigatō gozaimashita. But... may I ask why?
Uh, well, you see... Marks said it was a good idea...
And you listened to what that buffoon had to say?
Do I have to apologize again?
I am joking. I love it! Oh this one has ginger in it, fun!
Are we good?
If by good, you mean our bonds of companionship have been strengthened - then, yes, Kanchou. Very much so.
Excellent, Lady Naka! Let's report to the bridge, where we can get a handle on this stowaway situation.
I want to give you something as well. Here. It's a Shinto charm that protects you in battle.
Arigatō, Naka.
All I'm saying is what's wrong with throwing her overboard?
Marks!
Have you heard anything, Naka? Anything she's been saying in her bunk?
I haven't heard anything useful, Kanchou. She might know we're keeping an eye on her.
Or in this case, an ear.
Lieutenant, have we heard from the Soviet recovery team? Have they located the wreck yet?
They are on their way, Captain, but haven't arrived yet.
Right. I believe we should rendezvous with the Soviets at the wreck.
What are you thinking, Kanchou?
I'm thinking our guest can tell *us* about the extent of her involvement or she can tell our Soviet friends. That might loosen her tongue a bit.
Flawless execution, Kanchou!
Don't look now, but Morganas steaming in, fast!
@BATTLE
Coordinates plotted to rendezvous with the Soviets off the Kamchatka peninsula, near the wreck.
Excellent, Officer. In the meantime, I need you to keep an eye on our prisoner.
You mean our "guest," Marcella? Can do, Kanchou!
See to it, then!
On my way.

Fields.MenuText: Loved... ones?
But recently?
Love can mean so many things!

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, you know, that special someone. Next time we pull into a Japanese port maybe I'll talk him into getting me one...
Well, now I understand that you don't need gifts to be happy! Just getting someone to understand he doesn't need to be talking every second of... never mind, Kanchou.
It's so mysterious, just like the Naka herself!
Captain! Morganas on radar! Coming from behind!
@BATTLE
By the way, nice amulet. I'm actually a little bit jealous. Until... recently, I never had a special loved one who would have wanted to give me one.
It appears that Officer Furuichi has a sharp eye on Marcella. She's an excellent supervisor.
We both know that Furuichi is good at keeping an eye on the more childlike members of our crew.
Kanchou - I want to thank you for taking this course of action. I feel compelled to seek justice for those horrific deaths. By holding her accountable, we bring the victims closure.

Fields.MenuText: I'd do anything for you.
It's nothing. It's what the Neutrality Fleet's code of justice demands. If you squint at it right.
If we don't stand up for the weakest, then we are nothing more than criminals ourselves!

Fields.DialogueText: And I too, my Kanchou.
I always wanted a kanchou who appreciated regulation as much as I do.
Justice and love shall prevail! Uh, Justice shall prevail!
Hello, crew! Care for a tea break? I'm helping Marcella!
That's fantastic. I'm good for the moment.
Miss Naka? I've heard you prefer green tea?
Thank you. I'll take one cup. (Sips) This is delicious, Arigatō.
You're welcome, I think. Well, we have to see to dinner, bye!
You mean "by your leave!" She's still learning.
I... I suddenly feel very tired. I need to lie down.
Naka? Naka!
Huh? Hmmm. Shhh, good night, sweet Kanchou. I love –
She's out cold! We need a doctor, now!
And somebody get our prisoner back in the damn brig! You don't have to be gentle about it!
Naka! Is everything okay? How are you feeling? How many fingers am I holding up?
Two fingers and a thumb. I'm fine. Something was in that tea. Not strong enough to kill me.
I'm sorry - let's get back to the important stuff. I'm glad you're all right. Can I get you anything?
Marcella's head on a platter.
It's Marcella!
We know! She poisoned Naka!
Whaaaaat? No, she kidnapped Furuichi! She's got her hostage in the engine room!
This is getting madder and madder!
On top of that, Morgana ships closing in from the northwest.
Argh! We have to get Furuichi!
I'll see what I can do. You two get to the bridge and fend them off!
@BATTLE
Yeah, not for lack of trying. We had it tested, and it would've killed any human pretty damn handily.
Incoming fire! Let's kick those Morganas out of the ocean!
@BATTLE
With Marcella in the engine room, no one can get in or out! She could disable our power and leave us completely defenseless against the Morganas!
We're not far from the wreck, now. I'd like this mess wrapped up by the time we get there so we can hand her off to a bunch of angry Russians.
What are you thinking, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I'm thinking you and I take a quick break for a glass of sake.
You materialize in the engine room while we make a racket hitting the door. What else can we do?
You're the ship! Can't you turn it against her?

Fields.DialogueText: This is not the time for personal matters.
We could hurt Officer Furuichi! I'm sorry, but that is a risk we shouldn't take!
Not without putting Furuichi in harm's way. We all know Marks wouldn't let us hear the end of that.
I have her list of demands! One: money. Two: for us to pull into Singapore. Three: that we sink the Soviet ship coming our way.
No, no, and hell no. That is murder and completely violates the fragile peace we have.
You have to do something, Captain. I... I can't believe I'm saying this, but I love her!
We know, Lieutenant. Your feelings are not well hidden.
Okay, well... then let's come up with some ideas!
My head has been foggy since that cup of tea. Why would she poison me?
Probably because she knows you hear everything on the ship. She needed you disabled for a few hours.
Disabled... That's it! We need to kill the engines! As the kami of the ship, I can do that remotely!
Are you mad!? That will lead the Morganas right to us!
Exactly, which will cause Marcella to bail as fast as possible - straight for the lifeboats.
Which is where we attack!
Just... make sure she doesn't hurt Furuichi.
I have ears on the ship! At the first whisper of violence, we'll stop!
My faith is in you. Let's do this!
Uh, yeah.
Everybody in place?
Guns loaded!
Ok, I'm shutting down the engines in three, two, one... hrrrrng!
Hanging in there?
Don't talk to me! Can't focus!
What, lights off? Engines off.
*ALARM*
Morganas coming! We're sitting ducks. That's it, sister, you're coming with me. We're busting out of here!
Where are you taking me?
To the lifeboats, where else?
Grab her!
HYAAAAH!
What the? Ow! Ow! Agh! Help!
You're under arrest for kidnapping, piracy, and pistol whipping me earlier!
My hero!
Anything for my lady. Let's get this prisoner somewhere dark, unpleasant, and cramped!
Are you all right?
A little engine fatigue. Nothing a long soak won't restore!
It's going to have to wait a little longer. That alarm wasn't fake, and boy are those Morganas hurrying in!
@BATTLE
What do you want?
You see that Soviet ship, in the distance? Lieutenant Marks is on the radio with them right now, and all he has to do is let them know we have a murderer on our deck.
What are you talking about, murderer? I was part of Vickers's crew for only a few months, maybe a year, three tops!
We know Vickers sunk a Russian freighter recently, and we know you were on that ship. We will send you over to the Soviets. We assure you, you will pay for your crimes!
No, please! Don't do it! I swear, I was captured as a young child and sold onto the pirate ship! I was forced to do everything I did!
That's not what you said in the engine room.
Rats...
You said, and I quote, "Once you get a taste of a life of crime, you'll do anything to keep it up. Boarding that pirate ship was the best decision of my life."
Are you really going to turn me over to the Soviets?

Fields.MenuText: Of course we are.
Would you prefer we try you here?
If Marks had his way, you would have been dead.

Fields.DialogueText: It's finished, then.
How about a trial in Singapore?
At this point, I'm as good as dead!
Soviets sending distress signal, Captain. Morgana fleet closing in. It appears to be massive! They need help!
We'll deal with her after the battle. For now, concentrate all fire on the Morgana line!
Morganas...
@BATTLE
Quick! They're sailing away! Chase them!
@BATTLE
Take me with you!
Kanchou, she's gone overboard!
Take me, Morganas! You're the only hope I have!
(Speaks in foreign language)
Yes, yes! Freedom! Ach... Conssssume. Helllll...
I can't imagine choosing such a fate, Kanchou. A fate worse than death.
We did it! All the remnants of the pirate crew have been whisked away!
The Soviets are recovering the last of the victims. We have done all we can!
Is that a pendant on your necklace, Officer?
Yeah, Marks gave it to me. A Shinto protection amulet! Look at the pearl inlay.
I may have picked it up a while back. I was waiting for the right time to give it to you.
You're not going soft, are you? I'll have to shape you back up! Twenty press-ups, on the double! Now now!
Why don't you two go get your exercise somewhere more private? I think we're done here, for now.
Ehehehe! Yes, Captain! Afterwards, Furuichi, you and I need to plot our voyage back to Sasebo.
You can be the kanchou, and I will draw the chart...
Are you encouraging them?

Fields.MenuText: Can't a captain have a little fun with the crew?
I haven't the faintest idea what you mean.
You might think that, but I couldn't possibly comment.

Fields.DialogueText: As long as it doesn't get out of control.
I strangely don't believe you.
Caginess doesn't suit you, Kanchou.
I guess it's only us now.
It is indeed, Kanchou - shall I leave?
No, please stay, if you want. It's nice.
Hai, Kanchou. Hai.
I've... never seen a Morgana feeder swarm take a person before. Steel, sure, but...
Naka, I wanted to talk about Marcella. I know that she didn't admit to or atone for her crimes.
She's "the one who got away," Kanchou.
In this mad world, those who do evil don't always repent, and even more aren't brought to justice.
She was swallowed up by the Morganas, so to speak.
Regardless of if she was brought to justice or not, you sought justice for the victims. And justice you found.
Those victims can rest easily, knowing that Vickers, his crew, and Marcella were all found and held accountable.
They can rest, knowing that you fought for their honor and dignity. It was you who brought them peace, through your sense of duty. For that, I owe you my respect.
Kanchou! This is too much praise to comprehend! I was only doing what I was born to do.
I have never met a woman, err, Belle, that ever has shown such conviction. What I'm trying to say is. Naka, I... I would have done the same for you as Marks did for Furuichi.
I have never felt about any person the way I feel about you, Kanchou. I want you.
It's only us, it's quiet. Will you come with me to my quarters?
Hai, I have some aged sake that we can enjoy...
Naka, do you have a minute? I was hoping we could-
I'm sorry, Kanchou. Neither one of us has a minute right now - can it wait?
... Of course. But I'm glad I'm going to be able to work off the frustration.
@BATTLE
I'm feeling pretty intoxicated already.
